means: （尤指巨屋、名宅的）房间( apartment的名词复数 )
（尤指在同一楼层的）公寓套房

sentence.Network_en: Three-fourths of the apartments in the ghetto had no heat.
sentence.Network_cn: 贫民区有3/4的公寓没有暖气。

sentence.Network_en: Prices have been cut by developers anxious to offload unsold apartments.
sentence.Network_cn: 急于脱手未售出公寓的开发商降低了房价。

sentence.Network_en: The brochure offers a wide choice of hotels, apartments and holiday homes.
sentence.Network_cn: 这本小册子提供了很多宾馆、公寓、度假屋供选择。

the High apartments , service apartments and high-style villa rents are showing declines .期间，高级公寓、服务式公寓和高级别墅的租金均呈现跌幅。
estate concept was started almost exhausted , villas , apartments in continuous pressure , although the arrogance , but in reality moribund .地产概念几乎被玩得山穷水尽，别墅、豪宅在连续的打压中气焰虽在，实则奄奄一息。

entry.tran: （通常指在同一楼层的）公寓套房
entry.def: An apartment is a set of rooms for living in, usually on one floor of a large building.

example.ex: Christina has her own apartment, with her own car.
example.tran: 克里斯蒂娜有自己的公寓和汽车。
到处是水泥公寓楼群的沉闷的城市

entry.tran: （国王、王后、总统等要人居住的）套间，套房
entry.def: The apartments of an important person such as a king, queen, or president are a set of large rooms which are used by them.

example.ex: ...the private apartments of the Prince of Wales at St James's Palace.
example.tran: 威尔士亲王在圣詹姆斯宫的私人套房
